00015 #include "stdio.h"
00016 #include "math.h"
00017 #include "stdlib.h"
00018 
00019 #include "utility.h"
00020 
00021 #define TRUE 1
00022 #define FALSE 0
00023 
00024 /*!*****************************************************************************
00025  *******************************************************************************
00026 \note  my_inv_ldlt
00027 \date  August 93
00028 
00029 \remarks 
00030 
00031        take the elements of A x = b and generates x.
00032        note: A must be symmetric
00033 
00034  *******************************************************************************
00035  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00036 
00037       none
00038 
00039  ******************************************************************************/
00040 int
00041 my_inv_ldlt(double **a_mat, double *b_vec, int n_dim, double *x_vec)
00042 
00043 
00044 {
00045 
00046   double              tolerance = 1.0e-30;
00047   double              dk, lik;
00048   int                 i, j, k, p;
00049   double              zi;
00050   double              xi;
00051 
00052 
00053 
00054   double **ldlt_l;
00055   double  *ldlt_d;
00056   double  *ldlt_z;
00057   double  *ldlt_y;
00058   double  *ldlt_r;
00059 
00060 
00061   /* some temporary arrays and matrices */
00062 
00063   ldlt_l = my_matrix(1, n_dim, 1, n_dim);
00064   ldlt_d = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00065   ldlt_r = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00066   ldlt_y = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00067   ldlt_z = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00068  
00069   
00070   /* Compute the L matrix and D vector from a_mat */
00071   
00072   
00073   /* copy a_mat to l matrix */
00074   
00075   for (k = 1; k <= n_dim; ++k) {
00076     ldlt_l[k][k] = a_mat[k][k];
00077     for (j = k + 1; j <= n_dim; ++j) {
00078       ldlt_l[j][k] = ldlt_l[k][j] = a_mat[k][j];
00079     }
00080   }
00081   
00082   /* this does Gaussian elimination for the symmetric matrix;
00083          the result should be just a diagonal matrix */
00084 
00085   for (k = 1; k <= n_dim; ++k) {
00086     for (p = 1; p < k; ++p) {
00087       ldlt_r[p] = ldlt_d[p] * ldlt_l[k][p];
00088     }
00089     dk = ldlt_l[k][k];
00090     for (p = 1; p < k; ++p) {
00091       dk -= ldlt_l[k][p] * ldlt_r[p];
00092     }
00093     ldlt_d[k] = dk;
00094     if (fabs(dk) <= tolerance) {
00095       printf("\nLDLT singular matrix: d(%d) = %f\n", k, dk);
00096       return FALSE;
00097     }
00098     for (i = k + 1; i <= n_dim; ++i) {
00099       lik = ldlt_l[i][k];
00100       for (p = 1; p < k; ++p) {
00101                 lik -= ldlt_l[i][p] * ldlt_r[p];
00102       }
00103 
00104       ldlt_l[i][k] = lik / dk;
00105     }
00106   }
00107   
00108   /* clean up l matrix */
00109   
00110     for (k = 1; k <= n_dim; k++) {
00111       ldlt_l[k][k] = 1.0;
00112       for (j = 1; j < k; j++) {
00113                 ldlt_l[j][k] = 0.0;
00114       }
00115     }
00116 
00117 
00118   /* Compute Lz = b_vec  and  Dy = z: this is back substitution */
00119 
00120   for (i = 1; i <= n_dim; i++) {
00121     zi = b_vec[i];
00122     for (j = 1; j < i; j++) {
00123       zi -= ldlt_z[j] * ldlt_l[i][j];
00124     }
00125     ldlt_z[i] = zi;
00126   }
00127   
00128   
00129   for (i = 1; i <= n_dim; i++) {
00130     ldlt_y[i] = ldlt_z[i] / ldlt_d[i];
00131   }
00132 
00133 
00134   /* Compute L^T*x = y.: back substitution part two */
00135 
00136 
00137   for (i = n_dim; i >= 1; i--) {
00138     xi = ldlt_y[i];
00139     for (j = i + 1; j <= n_dim; ++j) {
00140       xi -= x_vec[j] * ldlt_l[j][i];
00141     }
00142     x_vec[i] = xi;
00143     
00144   }
00145   
00146 
00147   my_free_matrix(ldlt_l,1, n_dim, 1, n_dim);
00148   my_free_vector(ldlt_d,1,n_dim);
00149   my_free_vector(ldlt_r,1,n_dim);
00150   my_free_vector(ldlt_y,1,n_dim);
00151   my_free_vector(ldlt_z,1,n_dim);
00152 
00153   return TRUE;
00154 
00155 }
